instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - woes
threads.message:
Hello, have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no liquid damage - does not chime and does not start .
voltage @ <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> fluctuates from 16.9 v down to 3.3volts and then back up again. as such, computer wont boot. power isnt stable @ <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>.
Replaced <CHIP>ISL6295</CHIP> but no change, Checked Current limiting circuit and resistors/ caps , all check out fine. would love to see if this board is bootable or in the junk heap.
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - woes
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - woes
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - woes
threads.message: WOW>. put alcohol on some suspect chips, <CHIP>U7500</CHIP> fried. Changed and now voltage present and no more fluctuations. Now starts but no screen. no backlight no chime...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - woes
threads.message:
USB mouse?
Do you get VCORE?
Changed DDR?
Tried any reset?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - woes
threads.message: <CHIP>U7500</CHIP> died and MCP core went high. Dead MCP is very likely.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - woes
threads.message: but i have pp vcore, smc core , proper khz reading from RTC crystals? am i missing something here? i will replace this if you think that is what it is .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - woes
threads.message:
trackpad disconnected
vcore present
changed ddr, 
tried pram and smc reset. nothing changed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - woes
threads.message: will change mcp and post when done.
